Item.Description:
This operation performs a selection among multiple actions or results by comparing a test value with a set of predefined cases
**Typical Use:**
- if the test value matches any case value, **MatchCase** returns the corresponding result or executes the linked action
- multiple **Case** nodes can be connected to the `Cases` input to form a switch-like selection chain
- a `Default` action can be specified and will be returned if none of the cases match
- **Example:**
Color update from a **Box** dimensions
- `Value`=Length - `Cases`: **Case**(`MatchValue`=500, `Function`=**ColorInput 4**) **Case**(`MatchValue`=1000, `Function`=**ColorInput 5**) **Case**(`MatchValue`=[750, ..., 800], `Function`=**ColorInput 7**) - `Default`=**ColorInput 8**
- `Result`: if the Length is set to 500, the cube will be in green; if it's 1000, the cube will be in pink; in any value between 750 and 800 (inclusive) it will be blue; for all the others cases, the cube will be orange.

Default value if none case matches the input `Value`

This operation defines a single comparison rule for use with a **MatchCase** node.
The **Case** node associates a specific condition (single value or a list of values) with a result or action to be returned when matched.
**Typical Use:**
- set the value to match with `MatchValue` and specify the corresponding action or result in `Function`
- multiple **Case** nodes can be connected to the `Cases` input of **MatchCase** to form a switch-like selection chain
- for matching several values (such as [0,5,10]), set `MatchValue` as a list
